seriesStmt.p: Digital born transcriptions of letters from Vernon Lee to H.G. Wells

notesStmt.note: Written a day after England declares war on Germany. Lee gives her views on the conflict. SHe thinks Germany's perceived threat against Belgian neutrality is "bosh". The real problem is that Russia and France and the Entente have pushed England into war. She sympathizes with Germany.

div.p: It doesn’t seem likely that I shall get to you on the 10th; all trains here in the south are disorganized, + I don’t know in the least where I shall, or indeed can, go. I am very sorry, for I should have liked to see you + hear what Mr Wells has to say. Bar atomic bombs, it seems all just as bad and absurd + horrible as the War in his last book. Only will any the United States of Europe, indeed anything except famine + barbarism, come out of it? I have tried to understand + to me it seems England has made this Belgian business a mere excuse: what else is the meaning of the W.G. asking “Whether we could have looked on from Folkestone Leas at Boulogne being bombarded” - And in this war, much as I dislike Prussian Junkerdom (which war + the fear of war alone makes dominant) my abhorrence of Russia - abhorrence inherited from my father who was brought up in Poland + strengthened by all I have seen + read - entirely throws my sympathies onto the German side. France has been worked up to this pass by Russia + by us + our Entente: before 1904 there was practically no nationalism, or if so, against England. Alsace itself will be trampled + destroyed; its commercial interests bound it to Germany + it wanted only autonomy as a state of the Empire - All this I have gathered not from German friends, for I have but few + am not in correspondence with them, but from French ones, of whom I have many. We do not see that we - or rather Russia using us - surrounded Germany with a wall of enemies which she must break through. All the Belgian neutrality is bosh: first because Germany offered to respect Belgium’s independence providing she let her have free passage; + we have not put Belgium in the position of being eventually destroyed if Germany gets the better: we simply real neutrality of Belgium + real independence would have meant leaving her to accept Germany’s proposal, instead of ( as of course we + France have) bullying the unfortunately little country into saying no, + embroiling her as chief battlefield.

Forgive my pouring out: I want all my friends to know just to what an extent I am utterly out of sympathy with our Govt, our parliament, + I fear, with our nation which in four days has become the prey of Daily Mail + Times. I don’t know whether even you will want to see me later, people are so queer + perhaps one has to be a cosmopolitan in education + without English belongings to escape war fever. So I am doubly sorry not to be able to come there. I am staying on here till the railway service becomes regular; + letters are forwarded from 6 Chesham Street. S.W. Poor Elizabeth Arnim; it must be hard for her.
div.closer: Remember me to H.G.W. + believe me Yours always
